result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael T Campbell

records.addlTxt: to Ct from Dr. Seifert Lynch re:  brief continuance to complete report
CAMPBELL NO CONTACT LTR

Def called to get zoom information for a family case, writer provided information.  Writer also stated that there is a bond that needs to be signed and if he could come in and sign, def stated he would be in to sign.  Writer also confirmed address and phone number which is correct.

Writer attempted to call def again to sign bond and received message that mailbox is full and cannot receive messages at this time.  Will follow through with Atty to see if they have gotten bond signed.
to Ct from Dr. Seifert Lynch re:  extension
Competency hearing on November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:13 AM Defendant Michael T Campbell in court.  Attorney Blake Gross appeared by video for Michael T Campbell.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF30, 22CF68, 22CF81, 22CF112, and 22CF126.  Order in file for competency examination, one hasn't been completed, there is no extension letter.  Def, states no one has contacted to have an examination.  JA to check into status of examination.  Stipulation for good cause, court finds good cause no efforts have been made.
Competency hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael T Campbell
Current: 3600 Ellis Ave, Ashland, WI 54806   (Effective: 09-26-2022)
Prior: 2300 lake Shore Drive, Ashland, WI 54806
Writer tried calling def to sign bond, phone just gives a busy signal.  Emailed copy of bond to Atty to see if they can reach def to come in or have them sign and return bond.

Def to have NO Contact w/ M.L.C.
Follow all court orders, even those that may be as a result of another county.
Competency hearing on October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:09 AM Attorney Blake Gross appeared by video for Michael T Campbell.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Cases 22CF30, 22CF68, 22CF81, 22CF112, and 22CF126.  Defendant Michael T Campbell appeared by video.  22CF112 and 22CF126 are in need of initial appearance.  Atty has recv'd copy of compliant, atty requesting examination for competency.  In 3 older cases are post arraignment in 112 and 126 reviewed find probable cause that def has committed a crime in Ashland County.  Court orders competency in all cases.
Competency hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Cases 22CF30, 22CF68, 22CF81, 22CF112, and 22CF126.  22CF30 here for STC.  22CF68 and 22CF81 arraignment.  22CF112 Initial appearance not sure if completed.  22CF126 initial appearance, def does not have a copy of compliant just filed this morning, attorney not on case.  Attorney, 22CF112 has not talked to def regarding, waive time limits in preliminary hearing.  2CF68 and 22CF81 received information and waives reading, pleas NG, entered.  Defendant Michael T Campbell appeared by video. Appointing Mr. Gross in 22CF126, asking for cases to track, need to do AIA in 22CF126 and 22CF112, STC in remaining cases.  22CF126 court reviewed compliant, finds probable cause that a felony has been committed in Ashland county.  State comments on conditions for release, no abusive contact with victim M.L.C. and to follow all court orders.  Attorney comments.  Def can come to court, needs to sign by the end of business today.

records.addlTxt: Def to have NO Contact w/ J.C.

10:14 AM Defendant Michael T Campbell in court.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Gross has not seen compl, State emailed copy to the atty. Atty has not talked about this case with the def. Attempted service was done on June 20th. Ct comments, def was not served, Ct finds PC the def committed a crime in Ashland County. Ct understands why the State schd the hearing with his other cases, but not a big fan of the schd. The Ct is open to dealing with it. Ct prints a copy of the compl. Off the record (10:19am) Back on the record (10:34am) Waiver of prelim and schd was done. Def has a new pending case. Atty now apprs in person with the def. Atty comments- ready for init. Atty is County apt'd Ct orders the atty take the new case 22CF112- Def rec'd compl, went over the compl, waives reading of the compl, will waive TL for prelim, but set it. State comments on bail/bond . Atty comments on bail/bond 
Ct orders- $2500 sign bond, NC with J.C. in any form 
Will waive Tl for prelim
